articleinfo.title: Fedict eID Digital Signature Service Administrator Manual

abstract.para: This manual serves as an entry point for setting up the eID Digital Signature Service. The target audience is system administrators.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document (in uppercase, as shown) are to be interpreted as described in [RFC2119] .

The eID Digital Signature Service provides three major service artifacts:
eID Digital Signature Service portal
Via this web portal citizens can sign document and verify signatures on documents.
eID Digital Signature Service signature validation web service.
Via this SOAP web service Relying Parties (aka Service Providers) can verify signatures on documents. This web service is constructed according to the OASIS DSS web service standard.
The eID DSS signature creation portal.
Via this portal Relying Parties can create signatures on documents.
Besides these two service artifacts, the eID DSS also comes with an Admin portal that allows administrators to manage the eID DSS via an easy to use web portal interface. In the following sections we will use $EID_DSS_ADDRESS as the (internal) web address where the eID DSS product has been deployed.

The source code of the Fedict eID Digital Signature Service is publicly available and can be found at eID Digital Signature Service Source Code . Please note that the Fedict eID DSS has dependencies on the eID Trust Service product, which can be found at eID Trust Service source code .

section.title: Installation
section.para: The eID Digital Signature Service JBoss distribution is based on the eID Trust Service JBoss distribution. This means that all generic eID Trust Service configuration is also applicable to the eID Digital Signature Service. We refer to the eID Trust Service Administrator Manual for all non eID DSS specific configuration aspects.
